org.gearvrf

Class GVRPicker.GVRPickedObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRPicker.GVRPickedObject
  • Enclosing class:
    GVRPicker

    public static final class GVRPicker.GVRPickedObject
extends java.lang.Object
    The result of a pick request which hits an object.

    When a pick request is performed, each collision is described as a GVRPickedObject.

    Since:
    1.6.6
    See Also:
    GVRPicker.pickObjects(GVRScene, float, float, float, float, float, float), GVRPicker.findObjects(GVRScene)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[] getBarycentricCoords()
      The barycentric coordinates of the hit location on the collided face Returns null if the coordinates haven't been calculated.
      int getFaceIndex()
      The barycentric coordinates of the hit location on the collided face This will return -1 if the faceIndex isn't calculated
      GVRCollider getHitCollider()
      The GVRCollider that the ray intersected.
      float getHitDistance()
      The distance from the origin of the pick ray
      float[] getHitLocation()
      The hit location, as an [x, y, z] array.
      GVRSceneObject getHitObject()
      The GVRSceneObject that the ray intersected.
      float[] getNormalCoords()
      The normalized surface normal of the hit location on the mesh (in local coordinates).
      float[] getTextureCoords()
      The UV texture coordinates of the hit location on the mesh Returns null if the coordinates haven't been calculated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRPickedObject

        public GVRPickedObject(GVRCollider hitCollider,
                       float[] hitLocation,
                       float hitDistance,
                       int faceIndex,
                       float[] barycentricCoords,
                       float[] textureCoords,
                       float[] normalCoords)
        Creates a new instance of GVRPicker.GVRPickedObject.
        Parameters:
        hitCollider - The GVRCollider that the ray intersected.
        hitDistance - The distance from the origin if the ray.
        hitLocation - The hit location, as an [x, y, z] array.
        faceIndex - The index of the face intersected if a GVRMeshCollider was attached to the GVRSceneObject, -1 otherwise
        barycentricCoords - The barycentric coordinates of the hit location on the intersected face if a GVRMeshCollider was attached to the GVRSceneObject, [ -1.0f, -1.0f, -1.0f ] otherwise.
        textureCoords - The texture coordinates of the hit location on the intersected face if a GVRMeshCollider was attached to the GVRSceneObject, [ -1.0f, -1.0f ] otherwise.
        See Also:
        GVRPicker.pickObjects(GVRScene, float, float, float, float, float, float), GVRCollider

      • GVRPickedObject

        public GVRPickedObject(GVRCollider hitCollider,
                       float[] hitLocation,
                       float hitDistance)

      • GVRPickedObject

        public GVRPickedObject(GVRSceneObject hitObject,
                       float[] hitLocation)

    • Method Detail

      • getHitObject

        public GVRSceneObject getHitObject()
        The GVRSceneObject that the ray intersected. This is the owner of the collider hit.
        Returns:
        scene object hit
        See Also:
        GVRComponent.getOwnerObject()

      • getHitCollider

        public GVRCollider getHitCollider()
        The GVRCollider that the ray intersected.
        Returns:
        collider hit

      • getHitLocation

        public float[] getHitLocation()
        The hit location, as an [x, y, z] array.
        Returns:
        A copy of the hit result

      • getHitDistance

        public float getHitDistance()
        The distance from the origin of the pick ray

      • getFaceIndex

        public int getFaceIndex()
        The barycentric coordinates of the hit location on the collided face This will return -1 if the faceIndex isn't calculated

      • getBarycentricCoords

        public float[] getBarycentricCoords()
        The barycentric coordinates of the hit location on the collided face Returns null if the coordinates haven't been calculated.

      • getTextureCoords

        public float[] getTextureCoords()
        The UV texture coordinates of the hit location on the mesh Returns null if the coordinates haven't been calculated.

      • getNormalCoords

        public float[] getNormalCoords()
        The normalized surface normal of the hit location on the mesh (in local coordinates). Returns null if the coordinates haven't been calculated.
